statements: SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs
SELECT log_id, responder_id FROM CommunicationLogs
SELECT timestamp, message FROM CommunicationLogs
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE responder_id = 1
SELECT log_id, message FROM CommunicationLogs ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 3
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE responder_id = 1 ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT log_id, timestamp FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE log_id < 100 AND responder_id = 3
SELECT log_id, message FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2023-01-01' AND '2023-02-01'
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE log_id IN (1, 3, 5) AND responder_id = 2 ORDER BY log_id
SELECT responder_id, COUNT(*) AS total_logs FROM CommunicationLogs GROUP BY responder_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2
SELECT * FROM emergency_logs;
SELECT log_id, log_message, timestamp FROM emergency_logs WHERE responder_id = 1;
SELECT responder_name, role, contact_number FROM responders;
SELECT responder_id, responder_name FROM responders WHERE role = 'Paramedic';
SELECT * FROM emergency_logs WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01 00:00:00' AND '2022-01-31 23:59:59';
SELECT * FROM emergency_logs
SELECT responder_name, role FROM responders
SELECT timestamp, log_message FROM emergency_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT log_id, log_message FROM emergency_logs WHERE responder_id = 2
SELECT responder_name, contact_number FROM responders ORDER BY responder_name ASC
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT responder_name, responder_role FROM emergency_responders WHERE responder_role = 'Paramedic';
SELECT event_name, event_location FROM crisis_events ORDER BY event_date DESC;
SELECT responder_name, log_message FROM emergency_responders JOIN communication_logs ON emergency_responders.responder_id = communication_logs.responder_id;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs WHERE log_timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY log_timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT event_name, event_date, event_location FROM crisis_events ORDER BY event_date DESC;
SELECT responder_name, responder_role FROM emergency_responders WHERE responder_role = 'Paramedic';
SELECT event_name, event_date, event_location, event_description FROM crisis_events WHERE event_date >= '2022-01-01';

SELECT responder_name, log_timestamp, log_message FROM emergency_responders INNER JOIN communication_logs ON emergency_responders.responder_id = communication_logs.responder_id ORDER BY log_timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT responder_name, contact_number FROM emergency_responders ORDER BY responder_name DESC;
SELECT id, location, crisis_type FROM crisis_situations WHERE end_time IS NULL;
SELECT responder_id, situation_id, communication_time, message FROM communication_logs WHERE responder_id = 1;
SELECT responder_id, location FROM responder_locations WHERE last_updated > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY last_updated ASC;
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT responder_name, contact_number FROM emergency_responders WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM crisis_situations WHERE location = 'City Center' ORDER BY start_time DESC;
SELECT responder_name, location, last_updated FROM emergency_responders JOIN responder_locations ON emergency_responders.id = responder_locations.responder_id;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs WHERE communication_time >= '2022-01-01' AND communication_time <= '2022-12-31' AND message LIKE '%urgent%' ORDER BY communication_time DESC;
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT responder_id, responder_name FROM emergency_responders WHERE responder_role = 'Paramedic';
SELECT crisis_id, crisis_location, crisis_description FROM crisis_situations ORDER BY crisis_datetime DESC;
SELECT log_id, log_message, log_datetime FROM communication_logs WHERE responder_id = 1;
SELECT notification_id, notification_message, notification_datetime FROM alert_notifications WHERE crisis_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM emergency_responders;
SELECT responder_name, responder_role FROM emergency_responders ORDER BY responder_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM crisis_situations WHERE crisis_location LIKE '%City%' AND crisis_datetime > '2022-01-01';

SELECT c.crisis_location, cr.responder_name, cl.log_message FROM crisis_situations c JOIN communication_logs cl ON c.crisis_id = cl.crisis_id JOIN emergency_responders cr ON cl.responder_id = cr.responder_id;

SELECT cr.responder_name, COUNT(cl.log_id) AS log_count FROM emergency_responders cr LEFT JOIN communication_logs cl ON cr.responder_id = cl.responder_id GROUP BY cr.responder_name HAVING COUNT(cl.log_id) > 2;
